column5: What a beauty of a day,fresh snow,turkeys in the trees and the sun was a shine,n. Terry and I pack the bike up and head out.    Off we ride into the sunrise,with his rose coloured glasses.Lots of snow up there  Saturday folks,and I'm sure there is plenty more after yesterdays 2+ feet of dumping of snow.  Anyhoo, back to the day of fishing. Alls well til we get to the spot,  :o ,oh no were going through,  :o  Turnes out just to be lots of water on the ice under all the presure from the snow. We get a jigg,n and terry with his wonder machine 67X, says theres a fish,reels up and wham,fish on. Nice slab to start the day.   An hour or so goes by,we drill more holes,no action to be had. Terry,s playing with something on the bike and   :o I get a hookset on a fine little slab myself.    About 15 minutes later,I get this sudden stop while I'm jigg,n,set the hook and the battle was on what we thought was the king of all king crappies. Well it wasn't,but it was a nice 3+ pound bucket.     Quick release at the hole,and off she went. With the light breeze becoming wind gusts,we set up the clam and finish our day in it.Marked alot of fish,but they just were not active.They were not suspended,they were hugging the bottom. The last crappie for the day goes to Terry.    Cant wait to do it again.
she was cold and windy out there but I had a great time  the water was way to dark for the underwater camera..too bad....... <object width="425" height="350"><param name="movie" value="
Brian,crappies and turkey would of been a good day LOL. Was that a ratso jig you were useing bud,they do catch alot of fish. Thanks for the report.  Steve
Looks like a real fun day out there boys.  Good work.
Bike? 2 guys one bike? I think I`m in love? No just frozen! Just kidding! Nice report, except for the snow and ice!
hey..hey hey hey  it has the second seat, which sits up a little higher then the driver lots of room no unessasary push'n on the Cushion, as it were lol
LOL Terry, my neighbor and former partner for most of my bass tournies also fishes crappie tournies, I was always kind of amazed at the distances and things he went thru to fish them.
NICE LOOKIN SLABS BOYZ!!! TX FOR THE REPORT!!
looks like you guys had some fun!

but as always something breaks or goes wrong with my equipment had to McGiver something to replace the bolt       and even though there hasn't been an above zero day in 3 weeks we still found some slushy wet areas on the lake at first I thought we were going through...not happy thoughts when that is happening
Nice report Brian and Terry.  Scary about the ice....

Terry do they have TSC farm stores near you? Grade 8 bolts are a lot stronger than a grade 2 or 5, a grade 8 in that thing, if it didn`t already have one might not break when you need it most. Other places like a nut and bolt(fastner suppy) will have them too.
Nice report there guys!  The video was a nice touch too.  Must have been scary seein water!!! ACK!
Nice report..Guys.......& you would not catch me ever crossing ice on any snow mobile....To blooody chicken i am.
Good report, glad every tin worked out O'tay...
Nice McGyverin' there, Terry, you ol' bricoleur, you.
you could call me that necessity is the mother of invention and all that, and I have been called a mother** a few times
Looks like you guys had a great day Brian and Terry.  Was there enough fish to feed both of you  Cheers,  Joey
Maybe you should keep that boat on the side at all times Terry ! LOL Does make your heart beat when you hit that stuff...try it landing at 50 to 60 MPH and you think you're going into the lake!
Great report and pics!!! I love it when the Crappie are on the bottom, perfect Sabiki Rig time!
